summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Community Development Commission (CDC) of Dallas is convening for a special called monthly meeting on January 13, 2025, at 6:00 PM, both in-person at Dallas City Hall and via videoconference. The purpose of the meeting is to discuss community development initiatives, review financial reports, and make decisions regarding funding allocations.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of the minutes from the December 5, 2025, meeting.
2. Presentation of the Community Development Division Report, including an overview of the FY 2023-24 Annual Report and the FY 2025-26 HUD Budget Development Process.
3. Reports from the Chair and Vice Chair, including acknowledgments and updates on committee assignments.

**Important Details**:  
- The meeting will include a briefing on the timely expenditure of Community Development Block Grant (CDBG) funds.
- An action item will be presented regarding the approval of FY 2024-25 CDBG extensions and reprogramming funds recommendations.

**Action Items**:  
The commission will seek approval for the CDBG funding extensions and reprogramming recommendations. Additionally, the minutes from the previous meeting will need to be approved. Public participation will be facilitated through a registration process for those wishing to speak during the meeting. 

This meeting will also address any necessary accommodations to ensure equitable access for all participants.
